item.title: 6 Ways to Boost Your Snapchat Engagement
item.description:
6 Ways to Boost Your Snapchat Engagement

Want to know why you aren't getting more people watching your Snapchat stories? Did you jump onto Snapchat and are floundering around like a fish out of water trying to figure out if Snapchat is worth your time? Let's be blunt - the reason you're struggling is probably because your Stories are boring to watch.

item.title: 30+ Tools for Better Content Marketing
item.description:
30+ Tools for Better Content Marketing

By Ann Gynn published August 19, 2016 Open up your content marketing toolbox. Is it empty? Or is it so crowded that you can't find the tool you need? Content Marketing World presenters are here to help.

item.title: Litmus and Microsoft Partner to Make Email Better
item.description:
Litmus and Microsoft Partner to Make Email Better

By Paul Farnell It's our goal at Litmus to empower marketers to make better email. We all receive a ton of email. We want to help make the emails you receive more beautiful, engaging, and relevant. So, over the past 10 years, we've created the tools and resources to enable marketers to do just that.

item.title: Facebook organic reach drop steepens to 52% for publishers' Pages
item.description:
Facebook organic reach drop steepens to 52% for publishers' Pages

Publishers' organic reach on Facebook continues to plummet, but some have found a parachute. This year the number of people seeing the average post published a publisher's Facebook Page has been cut in half. From January 2016 through mid-July 2016, publishers' Facebook Pages have experienced a 52% decline in organic reach, according to social publishing tool SocialFlow.

item.title: Using iBeacons to Improve Prospective Student & Donor Experiences - edSocialMedia
item.description:
Using iBeacons to Improve Prospective Student & Donor Experiences - edSocialMedia

Like most innovations that come from the Cupertino wizards, the whole world of tech has been buzzing about iBeacons ever since Apple first mentioned them in their 2013 WWDC conference.

item.title: Why Measuring Content Experiences Drives Better Content Marketing
item.description:
Why Measuring Content Experiences Drives Better Content Marketing

This is a very special episode of Content Pros because we're joined by Randy's co-founder of Uberflip: Yoav Schwartz. Yoav's background is in product marketing, and he started and managed a number of marketing businesses before joining forces with Randy to found Uberflip.

item.title: 5 Extremely Actionable Tips to Improve Your Content Writing
item.description:
5 Extremely Actionable Tips to Improve Your Content Writing

I'm a terrible writer. That's correct - I'm a terrible writer and I'm going to teach you how to improve your content writing efforts. Oh, the irony! The thing is that even bad writers can learn how to mesmerize an online audience.

item.title: The three core values of successful marketing teams
item.description:
The three core values of successful marketing teams

I recently read that the average tenure of a Chief Marketing Officer is 24 months, up from 18 months not very long ago. While that's good progress, it's still much shorter than other c-level positions. Why is CMO tenure so short? It often comes down to the credibility of the marketing team.

item.title: What is Google RankBrain and How Does It Affect Your Website's SERP Rankings?
item.description:
What is Google RankBrain and How Does It Affect Your Website's SERP Rankings?

If you're involved with SEO, you know that Google (and the other search engines) uses a complex algorithm to determine how a page ranks in the search engine results pages (SERPs). No one but Google knows exactly what's in the algorithm's "secret sauce" (it's rumored that there are more than 200 factors it considers), but SEO experts have inklings about what makes a page rank higher than others.
